revised_title: Fossil Remains of Soft Parts in Foraminifera
tldr: The author, Gideon Algernon Mantell, examines fossil remains of the soft parts of Foraminifera found in the chalk and flint of South-East England. He describes the organization of these animalcules, including their shells, tentacles, and digestive organs, and discusses their relationship to the Cephalopoda. The paper is accompanied by drawings of the specimens.
